text: Edwin Meese III (born December 2, 1931) is an American attorney, law professor, and author. ==Early life== Meese was born on December 2, 1931 in Oakland, California. He studied at Yale University and at the University of California-Berkeley. ==Career== He served under Ronald Reagan's administration back when Reagan was Governor (1967–1974), the Reagan Presidential Transition Team (1980), and under Reagan's presidential administration (1981–1985). Meese was the 75th Attorney General of the United States (1985–1988), a position from which he resigned while serving in office under investigation from a special prosecutor.Edwin Meese profile, NNDB ==Honors== On October 8, 2019, president Donald Trump presented Meese the Presidential Medal of Freedom, the highest civilian honor in the United States. ==Books== * Judicial Tyranny: The New Kings of America? - contributing author (Amerisearch, 2005) * The Heritage Guide to the Constitution, * With Reagan, 1992, Regnery Gateway, 0-89526-522-2 ==References== ==Other websites== * Edwin Meese profile, NNDB * Attorney General's Commission on Pornography * Final Report of the Independent Counsel for Iran/Contra Matters - U.S. Court of Appeals * Meese's bio at the Mercatus Center * Category:1931 births Category:Living people Category:United States Attorneys General Category:Lawyers from Oakland, California Category:Educators from Oakland, California Category:Businesspeople from Oakland, California Category:Politicians from Oakland, California Category:Republican Party (United States) politicians
